timeline.bodyText: Can u explain me how this works? How do I add anew icon?
timeline.author: 1-alex98

replies.bodyText:
You can get the SVGPath string from icomoon:

Or from the source code of SVGs. https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FAForever/Art-Assets/master/FAF-Logo.svg
Or build it yourself: https://yqnn.github.io/svg-path-editor/
-fx-shape will apply the shape to whatever component you choose. If it's a button, the button will have the SVG shape. We apply it to Regions like <Region styleClass="icon,map-size-icon" /> and use this region as the graphic for the button.
The annoying thing about it is that either you set -fx-scale-shape: false, resulting in the "original" size being used (as specified in the SVGPath), which is rarely what you want. Or you set -fx-scale-shape: true resulting in the shape being adjusted to the region's size - without keeping the aspect ratio. So for each icon the dimensions must be specified.
However, the advantages are:

No need to generate a font
No need to keep the font and .json file in sync
No dependency to icomoon
Themes can easily replace individual icons. Right now, I don't even know how themes can set their own icons. The probably need to provide their own where the icons use the same unicode character, and set this font via CSS only for those nodes whose icon should be changed.
It's a standard JavaFX mechanism
